strategy: Improve feature engineering by creating additional interaction features between existing categorical variables.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
def create_interaction_features(df):
    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = 1
    df.loc[df['FamilySize'] > 1, 'IsAlone'] = 0
    return df

train = create_interaction_features(train)
test = create_interaction_features(test)

# Fill missing values
train['Age'].fillna(train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Age'].fillna(test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Fare'].fillna(test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
train.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
test.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
train.dropna(subset=['Embarked'], inplace=True)
test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train = pd.get_dummies(train, drop_first=True)
test = pd.get_dummies(test, drop_first=True)

# Split data
X_train = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y_train = train['Survived']
X_test = test.drop(columns=['PassengerId'])

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
def create_interaction_features(df):
    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = 1
    df.loc[df['FamilySize'] > 1, 'IsAlone'] = 0
    return df

train = create_interaction_features(train)
test = create_interaction_features(test)

# Fill missing values
train['Age'].fillna(train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Age'].fillna(test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Fare'].fillna(test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
train.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
test.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
train.dropna(subset=['Embarked'], inplace=True)
test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train = pd.get_dummies(train, drop_first=True)
test = pd.get_dummies(test, drop_first=True)

# Reorder columns in test to match train
test = test[train.columns]

# Split data
X_train = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y_train = train['Survived']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
def create_interaction_features(df):
    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = 1
    df.loc[df['FamilySize'] > 1, 'IsAlone'] = 0
    return df

train = create_interaction_features(train)
test = create_interaction_features(test)

# Fill missing values
train['Age'].fillna(train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Age'].fillna(test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Fare'].fillna(test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
train.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
test.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
train.dropna(subset=['Embarked'], inplace=True)
test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train = pd.get_dummies(train, drop_first=True)
test = pd.get_dummies(test, drop_first=True)

# Ensure both datasets have the same features
common_columns = train.columns.intersection(test.columns)
train = train[common_columns]
test = test[common_columns]

# Split data
X_train = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y_train = train['Survived']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
def create_interaction_features(df):
    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = 1
    df.loc[df['FamilySize'] > 1, 'IsAlone'] = 0
    return df

train = create_interaction_features(train)
test = create_interaction_features(test)

# Fill missing values
train['Age'].fillna(train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Age'].fillna(test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Fare'].fillna(test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
train.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
test.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
train.dropna(subset=['Embarked'], inplace=True)
test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train = pd.get_dummies(train, drop_first=True)
test = pd.get_dummies(test, drop_first=True)

# Ensure both datasets have the same features
common_columns = train.columns.intersection(test.columns)
train = train[common_columns]
test = test[common_columns]

# Check if 'Survived' column exists in train dataframe
if 'Survived' not in train.columns:
    raise ValueError("Column 'Survived' is missing in the training dataframe.")

y_train = train['Survived']

# Scale features

X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
print("Loading train data...")
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
print("Train data loaded successfully.")

print("Loading test data...")
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
print("Test data loaded successfully.")

# Feature engineering
def create_interaction_features(df):
    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = 1
    df.loc[df['FamilySize'] > 1, 'IsAlone'] = 0
    return df

train = create_interaction_features(train)
test = create_interaction_features(test)

# Fill missing values
train['Age'].fillna(train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Age'].fillna(test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Fare'].fillna(test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
train.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
test.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
train.dropna(subset=['Embarked'], inplace=True)
test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train = pd.get_dummies(train, drop_first=True)
test = pd.get_dummies(test, drop_first=True)

# Ensure both datasets have the same features
common_columns = train.columns.intersection(test.columns)
train = train[common_columns]
test = test[common_columns]

# Check if 'Survived' column exists in train dataframe
if 'Survived' not in train.columns:
    raise ValueError("Column 'Survived' is missing in the training dataframe.")

# Split data
X_train = train.drop(columns=['PassengerId', 'Survived'])
y_train = train['Survived']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data

print("Number of rows in test dataframe:")
print(len(test))

print(test.head())

    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = 1
    df.loc[df['FamilySize'] > 1, 'IsAlone'] = 0
    return df

test['Fare'].fillna(test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

# Load data
print("Loading train data...")
column_names = ['PassengerId', 'Survived', 'Pclass', 'Name', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Ticket', 'Fare', 'Cabin', 'Embarked']
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv', names=column_names)
print("Train data loaded successfully.")

print("Columns in train dataframe:")
print(train.columns)

print("Number of rows in train dataframe:")
print(len(train))

print("First few rows of train dataframe:")
print(train.head())

print("Loading test data...")
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
print("Test data loaded successfully.")

print("Columns in test dataframe:")
print(test.columns)

print("Number of rows in test dataframe:")
print(len(test))

print("First few rows of test dataframe:")
print(test.head())

# Feature engineering
def create_interaction_features(df):
    df['FamilySize'] = df['SibSp'] + df['Parch'] + 1
    df['IsAlone'] = 1
    df.loc[df['FamilySize'] > 1, 'IsAlone'] = 0
    return df

train = create_interaction_features(train)
test = create_interaction_features(test)

# Fill missing values
train['Age'].fillna(train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Age'].fillna(test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test['Fare'].fillna(test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
train.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
test.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
train.dropna(subset=['Embarked'], inplace=True)
test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
train = pd.get_dummies(train, drop_first=True)
test = pd.get_dummies(test, drop_first=True)

# Ensure both datasets have the same features
common_columns = train.columns.intersection(test.columns)
train = train[common_columns]
test = test[common_columns]

# Check if 'Survived' column exists in train datafr
